title: Gender Wage Gap Legislation Blocked by Senate Republicans
sub_head: Democrats needed 60 votes to overcome a Republican filibuster of Paycheck Fairness Act
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Senate Republicans blocked legislation aimed at narrowing the gender-based wage gap, marking the second filibuster of this year.
The vote was 49-50 on a procedural motion to take up the legislation, with Democrats voting yes and all Republicans voting no. Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand (D., N.Y.) was absent, but even had she voted, Democrats would have fallen short of the 60 votes needed to overcome Republican opposition.
(More to come.)
Write to Siobhan Hughes at siobhan.hughes@wsj.com
